variables.description: Boolean if the circular progress bars should be included.
Boolean if the linear progress bars should be included.
The top and bottom margin to apply to the circular and linear progress.

usedBy.description:
Includes the styles for progress bars if either `$include-circular` and/or `$include-linear`
are `true`.

Progress bars are always styled with the `secondary-color`. When using a `linear` progress bar,
the default background will be a swatch that is ligher than the `secondary-color`.

variables.description: The duration for one cycle of the circular progress animation.

usedBy.description: Creates the styles for a circular progress bar.

context.name: react-md-progress-circular

usedBy.description: Creates the styles for a linear progress bar.

variables.description:
The default swatch to use for the default linear progress bar background.
This should be either: 100, 200, 400, or 700.

usedBy.description:
Themes only the linear progress bars when the `$secondary-color` does not equal
the `$md-secondary-color` OR the `$swatch` does not equal the `$md-linear-progress-swatch`.

mixins.description:
Includes the styles for progress bars if either `$include-circular` and/or `$include-linear`
are `true`.

Progress bars are always styled with the `secondary-color`. When using a `linear` progress bar,
the default background will be a swatch that is ligher than the `secondary-color`.

parameter.name: secondary-color
parameter.description:
The secondary color to theme progress
    bars with.

parameter.name: linear-swatch
parameter.description:
The swatch number to use for
    a linear progress bar's default background. This should be either 100, 200, 400, or 700.

parameter.name: include-circular
parameter.description:
Boolean if the circular
    progress styles should be included.

parameter.name: include-linear
parameter.description:
Boolean if the linear
    progress styles should be included.

usedBy.description:
Includes every component, transition, and typography including their
media queries if the `$md-media-included` variable is `true`. You can
modify any global variables before including this mixin to change the overall
theme.

context.name: react-md-everything

Progress bars are always styled with the `secondary-color`. When using a `linear` progress bar,

mixins.description: Updates the theme for progress bars.

parameter.name: secondary-color
parameter.description:
The secondary color to theme progress
    bars with.

parameter.name: linear-swatch
parameter.description:
The swatch number to use for
    a linear progress bar's default background. This should be either 100, 200, 400, or 700.

parameter.name: include-circular
parameter.description:
Boolean if the circular
    progress styles should be included.

parameter.name: include-linear
parameter.description:
Boolean if the linear
    progress styles should be included.

usedBy.description:
Updates the styles of every component with the new theme colors. If there
are components that do not change if the `$light-theme` variable is the same,
their updated styles will not be included. This is useful if you want to switch
between the light or dark theme, or even the entire theme colors while keeping
the base css the same between all themes.

In addition, if the theme colors do not switch, those styles will not be created.
So this allows the same colors between light and dark themes.

If you switch between the light and dark theme, you will need to give a `$html-class-name`
That will nest every component inside.

context.name: react-md-theme-everything
